body: His ult did a lot of damage with AP before runeglaive existed you know :^)))))

replies.body: The biggest thing it did for AP Ez was fix his mana problems. He has always done a shit ton of damage, but usually had no mana early game to do it. Now this item fixed that and people are bitching and moaning about his damage.

What I think is more important than the extra mana from attacking jungle monsters, is the fact that he gained reliable waveclear outside of his ult, which has always been a problem with AP Ez. The fact that it allows him to proc Luden's further improves that (along with making his q poke stronger).

Plus, he hits a power spike earlier than ever, which strongly mitigates his previously weak early game.

It also turns the q into all magic damage so it benefits from mpen and adds .3 to Q's ratio, essentially making it .7 in total.

It just synergizes really really really well and fixes a lot of the problems that made AP ez an off build

The "problem" is that AP Ezreal has NEVER been an "off-build", it's just a less popular one. Everyone pretends like it's been Urgot-tier this whole time, sees AP Ez get played by pros and suddenly "OMG EZREAL SO BUFFED WTF NERF".


He's not really any stronger than he's ever been. He just got the spotlight for a minute.

> [{quoted}](name=Don Pavoni,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NcHUEH12,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-07-04T23:48:48.515+0000)

It turns his Q into magic damage. Not just increasing his AP scaling, **Runeglaive converts the damage of the entire attack to magic damage.** That's actually a pretty terrifying bit of power, making Magic Pen apply fully to his Q/basic attacks with Glaive procs.

so how is that strength that never was meant to be there? Dealing magical damage always was a strength of ap-ez, as everything besides the Q base+ad deal magic, and 50% of ap-ez Q damage came from LB, which again is magic.

The damage-convertion prettymuch makes up for 0,2 less ratio in the lategame compared to lichbane.

The damage conversion *more* than makes up for the 0.2 ratio difference, because Mystic Shot has 35/55/75/95/115 +110% total AD, +40% AP scaling dealt as physical damage. Converting just Mystic Shot's AP ratio to magic damage doubles up on the "lost" ratio from Lich Bane. Oh, and Runeglaive has its base AD scaling buffed from 75% to 100% on PBE.

(yes, Lich Bane Ezreal benefits from the 40% AP ratio, but it is still dealt as physical damage, which gets reduced more severely as Armor is naturally two to three times as plentiful *and* AP Ezreal does not build Armor Pen)

Runeglaive converting his whole attack to magic is *indisputably* stronger than Lich Bane's proc if you're playing AP Ezreal, unless you're playing him without magic pen *and* your opponents focus more on building MR than Armor.

it doesn't double up on the 'lost' ap ratio. it's not like the physical part of mystic shot deals no damage at all as ap EZ, especially not vs squishy targets.
RG also gives 40(soon 30) less ap.
the runeglaive buff also comes with the loss loss of spelleffeckts on it.

turning it to magic damage sure is strong, and the mian reason why it works that well, but it doesn't really get stronger than LB for a fullbuilt EZ, the main advantage from RG is that you can reach your power far earlyer than with a LB built without giving up on any lategame scaleing for it.

> [{quoted}](name=Don Pavoni,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NcHUEH12,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-05T13:16:22.305+0000)

Did you not read my disclaimer that said ***exactly the same thing?!?***

And, as a counter-point, all squishy opponents have more Armor than MR by level 6, coming somewhere between double and triple by level 18. And you're going to build Magic Pen on AP Ezreal, making their effective MR *even lower.*
> RG also gives 40(soon 30) less ap.
> the runeglaive buff also comes with the loss loss of spelleffects on it.

It was never supposed to have spell effects on it in the first place, that's a bug fix. I'm guessing, though, that they did intend it to change the whole attack to magic damage, since they didn't bother with that.
> turning it to magic damage sure is strong, and the main reason why it works that well, but it doesn't really get stronger than LB for a full-built EZ, the main advantage from RG is that you can reach your power far earlier than with a LB built without giving up on any lategame scaling for it.

Unless your opponent has equal resistances/more effective MR than Armor, Runeglaive will actually increase his effective damage more, especially post-buff.

115 +110% AD +40% AP dealt in physical damage, being reduced by 65-96 Armor, is effectively 135-160 +20.9% to 24.7% AP scaling.

Meanwhile, dealt in magic damage, being reduced by 30-53 MR, it is effectively 161-189 +26.6% to 31.2% AP scaling; with just Sorcs, it's bumped to 179-214 +29.6% to 35.3% AP scaling.

Due to how resistances scale, the actual difference between Lich Bane Ezreal and Runeglaive Ezreal is going to be in the neighborhood of 25-50 base, +10% to 15% of AP.

This damage was *without* calculating the Lich/Glaive procs respective damage values, because, until the PBE changes hit, it's the same amount. Once the PBE changes do land, Runeglaive gains up to +25 base damage on the proc. Mystic Shot's AP scaling *was* taken into account between Lich Bane and Runeglaive, though.

In the absolute best scenario--which doesn't exist because there isn't a champion with scaling MR and 60 base Armor at level 18--it would take Ezreal ~170 AP for Lich Bane to start dealing more damage. In the opposite best scenario--and I don't know of any champions with 90-ish base Armor and no scaling MR either--it would take 500 AP.

Using these numbers, it comes down to this; Lich Bane Ezreal gets a tidbit more single-target damage once he passes 300 AP in normal situations. But you have to *get* to that amount of AP for it to matter. Never mind that Runeglaive is AoE, so the moment it hits two targets, it's dealing more total damage *period.*

At the point of 700 AP, Lich Bane is doing in the neighborhood of 50 more damage to one target, give or take, without taking into account *any* defensive building at all on the target, runes or masteries.
